fields.name: Spelling mistake correction
fields.description: Correct the spelling mistakes in the following sentence

fields.question: are there any issues already occured with Android 2.2 ?
i'm prettyy sure that everything I've ever read says that the <kbd>Back</kbd> button is the right way to exit out of apps.
probably I will change ROM often, so my question.
btw mine is a nexus one
, how about the file itself, is it just an archive such as zip where during install the installer actually just extract and copy the file into system app?
this made me wondering how to see the version info of an application on my Galaxy S mobile phone.
do I loose all my widgets too or will it mostly change the way my Home screen looks?
other than the HTC mail and messaging apps having a possible memory leak issue [I replaced their use with K9 and Gmail, and Hancent], I've been pleased with Sense.
the phone checks the [IMSI][2] code of the inserted SIM card and check that it corresponds with the allowed country or network codes that the phone has been programmed with.
I find that unlocking the screen usually requires a few attempts and is difficult for me to do with just one hand (heh, ironicly the screen is too large to swipe across).
